text:
24 books about love that are not ashamed to read
04 Nov 2019, 22:00 by Oksana Klimova
Novels, proven over the years, and contemporary works that are worth your attention.
Classic literature
1. The Great Gatsby, Francis Scott Fitzgerald



A cult novel unfolds before readers a picture of American life in the mid-20s of the last century. Jazz, noisy parties, which are not hindered by the prohibition, and easy money - this is how the life of the rich and famous looks.
The protagonist, Jay Gatsby, is distinguished by an outstanding mind and tremendous vitality. These qualities helped him to become rich in order to win the heart of his beloved woman, empty and ordinary. But the love gained for a short time did not bring Gatsby happiness.

Buy a book

2. ‚ÄúPatterned Veil,‚Äù Somerset Maugham



Not all the gold that glitters - in order to understand this common truth, the main character of one of Maugham‚Äôs best novels had to go through many trials.
It seemed to the young woman that she was living a brilliant life, but all her aspirations, as it turned out, were false, and her attachments were empty. However, the real strong feeling and pain of loss forever changed Kitty and helped her eventually find herself.

Buy a book

3. The Arc de Triomphe, Erich Maria Remarque



A chance meeting of two lonely people in Paris. He is hiding from the Gestapo, she is trying to figure out her life. He loves, she masterfully plays in love. The tragic ending puts everything in its place and gives the protagonist hope for new happiness in another country.
This is not just a novel, it is the subtlest web of feelings and thoughts that will surely find a response in the soul of every reader.

Buy a book

4. ‚ÄúLady Chatterly's Lover,‚Äù David Herbert Lawrence



A young woman, Lady Chatterly, is married to a wonderful man. She has a position in society, honor and respect of others. But there is no love and no hope of motherhood. Driven into the framework of decency and tradition, she finds her happiness in the arms of another man, much lower than her on the social ladder.
Sensual and piercing history at one time aroused censure of the stiff English and was banned for publication until 1960.

Buy a book

5. "Dark Alleys", Ivan Bunin



The collection includes the best stories and short stories about love, passion and women. Each image was created by the author with great respect, awe and tenderness. We can say that this book is an ode to love, without which our life is unthinkable.

Buy a book

6. ‚ÄúGarnet bracelet‚Äù, Alexander Kuprin



Over her secret admirer of Princess Vera Nikolaevna her relatives and friends chuckle indulgently. On the day of her name day, she receives a gift from him - a garnet bracelet, which, due to her position, cannot be accepted in any way. To avoid scandal, a fan, a humble official, will forever leave the princess, whose image has been worshiped for many years.
The tragic ending leads Vera Nikolaevna to the idea that a huge, bright and pure feeling has passed by.

Buy a book

7. ‚ÄúSinging in Blackthorns,‚Äù Colin McCullough



All the best comes at the cost of suffering: in order to sing the best song, the bird throws itself into the thorniest thorns in the blackthorn, and people go through the ups and downs in order to find their happiness. This saga presents the life of the Cleary family. And each hero in it follows its own thorny path: from poverty to prosperity, from suffering to happiness, from loneliness to love.
The love of the main character Maggie and the priest Ralph de Brikassar passes through the whole story with a red thread.

Buy a book

8. ‚ÄúPride and Prejudice,‚Äù Jane Austen



Pride and prejudice - this is precisely what prevents the main character, Elizabeth Bennet, who is not rich and smart, from believing in the seriousness of the feelings of the noble aristocrat Mr. Darcy, the enviable groom and the object of dreams of many girls. After publication, this book immediately became one of the most popular novels about love and fate.

Buy a book

9. ‚ÄúAnna Karenina‚Äù, Leo Tolstoy



This is not just a romance about love, duty and family - it is an encyclopedia of life itself, told with deep feeling. The main character leaves a hateful husband and beloved son for the sake of happiness with another man.
Anna boldly looks into the eyes of a society that openly condemns her behavior. She feels loneliness and courageously suffers suffering, but she does not want and can not deviate from the chosen path. The heroine is honest with herself, and the tragic denouement only confirms her choice.

Buy a book

10. Jane Air, Charlotte Bronte



The whole world knows this story: the young governess Jane Eyre enters the service of Mr. Rochester‚Äôs house, to which, despite his gloom and outward severity, he even becomes attached.
Jane is poor, not pretty, and managed to experience many sorrows. And she does not immediately understand that a gloomy house holds many more secrets than it seems at first glance. Fate breeds the main characters - they are waiting for the test, but the true feeling helps to survive all the hardships and hardships.

Buy a book

11. Gone With the Wind, Margaret Mitchell



A legendary novel that needs no special introduction. The main character - the beautiful Scarlett O‚ÄôHara - has a proud disposition and strong character. And she desperately needs the love of Ashley Wilkes, the husband of her cousin.
In pursuit of what she was not destined to get, Scarlett does not notice the feelings of Rhett Butler, whom she married from hopelessness. However, the complete collapse of the family makes her think and overestimate her desires.

Buy a book

12. The Awakening, Kate Chopin



The life of the main character Edna is like a tedious dream: husband, children, cares. Outwardly, everything is fine, and it would seem that this is precisely what a woman should dream about. But at some point, Edna suddenly wakes up and realizes that she has her own desires. Including the desire to love and be loved.
As a result, the crushing power of love and romance with another man change not only the life of the main character, but also her attitude towards both people and herself.

Buy a book

Contemporary works
1. ‚ÄúThe English Patient,‚Äù Michael Ondatje



A young nurse, Khan, is caring for a burned man found in the desert. Nothing is known about him, and everyone calls him simply the "English patient."
The nurse reads him aloud, and gradually pictures from his past appear in front of him. A special place among them is the hero‚Äôs love story for a married woman. Sensual and tragic narrative will not leave readers indifferent.

Buy a book

2. The Reader, Bernhard Schlink



A piercing and touching love story of a mature woman and a 15-year-old boy who cuts deep into the heart. She asks him to read her aloud, he is surprised, but eagerly does it - perhaps not to find a more grateful listener. But their connection is broken by the sudden disappearance of the main character.
After 15 years, they meet again, but under unexpected circumstances. The novel's finale is sure to knock readers.

Buy a book

3. ‚ÄúLoneliness on the Web‚Äù, Janusz Wisniewski



Network correspondence for the two main characters becomes the basis of their passionate romance. They live in different countries, they have different professions and different lives on the other side of the screen.
Communication without obligations, but with the opportunity to speak out and share the innermost is captivating and addictive. They plan a meeting in real life, and the main intrigue is what will come of this virtual love when the characters see each other live.

Buy a book

4. ‚ÄúOne Day,‚Äù David Nichols



The main characters, Emma and Dexter, met by chance at the prom. They might never see each other again, but their friendship grew into something more. And for 20 years now, the main characters have been meeting in the same place on the same day.
Perhaps this is love, they are destined to be together and a happy future awaits them? The finale of the novel gives a definite answer to this question.

Buy a book

5. "Tenderness", David Fonkinos



They are not a couple, but they will be together. Natalie survived the loss and is in no hurry to rush into a new relationship, despite the efforts of the men around her. And her heart will be opened only to those who show exceptional delicacy and tenderness in relation to her fragile soul.
An elegant love affair became the basis of the film of the same name with Audrey Tautou in the title role.

Book a book

6. Possess, Anthony Bayette



Possess: truth, knowledge, heart, love. This desire characterizes the actions and relationships of the main characters, invented poets of the Victorian era and modern literary scholars.
A novel is a detective story, a novel is a love story that is read in one breath. The author‚Äôs incredible attempt to combine several genres was a success, and the appreciation of readers around the world is a confirmation of this.

Buy a book

7. ‚ÄúOne Story,‚Äù Julian Barnes



Each love story is unique and commonplace at the same time. It seems to lovers that they experience feelings hitherto unknown to the world. Others are sure that this happened millions of times.
The new novel by the Booker Prize laureate reveals what is happening in the heads and souls of loving people. The protagonist is almost 30 years younger than her chosen one. But the age difference does not become an obstacle to relationships and love, which can not be said about the views and habits of the characters.

Buy a book

8. The Atonement, Ian McEwan



The story of nascent love and passion is crossed out by perjury of a 13-year-old girl who misinterpreted what she saw from the window. And then comes the war, which turns the lives of the heroes and completes the destruction begun.
The main character, Briony, is obsessed with the idea of atonement for her own guilt and cannot shake off the hopes of somehow improving the lives of those who have suffered from her words. The incredible finale is a real gift from the writer to fans of his work.

Book a book

9. The Neapolitan Quartet, Elena Ferrante



A series of four books under the general title "Neapolitan Quartet", which tells about the life of two friends. Their days are filled with simple things: love, passion, sadness, joy, hope, pain and happiness.
Lena and Leela grew up where everyone is accustomed to rely only on themselves. Fate brings and divorces them, not forgetting to teach different lessons. All books are read in one breath and leave the most pleasant aftertaste.e.

Buy a book

10. ‚ÄúGod of the Little Things,‚Äù Arundati Roy



In the novel, we see colorful India, and against its background is the story of one family, which consists of many diverse events shown by the eyes of the main characters. This is love, and sadness, and all that makes up human existence.
Traditions, prejudices, the desire and need to follow morality, as well as a million colorful little things create a magnificent outline of this novel.

Buy a book

11. ‚ÄúI loved her. I loved him, "Anna Gavalda



The main character Chloe left her husband. He went to his mistress, despite two lovely daughters. The young woman is ready to give up, but her father-in-law, Pierre, intervenes in the matter.
His support and participation helps Chloe survive a difficult time and find the strength to believe in happiness and her own importance. Love never ends - the author convinces us of this.

Buy a book

12. ‚ÄúBridges of Madison County,‚Äù Robert Waller



Four days of happiness - and a long life with an unloved husband. This is exactly what happened with the exemplary wife and mother Francesca, who accidentally met photographer Robert. He goes to remove the bridges of Madison County, and she volunteers to show him the way.
Sunstroke, passion, flash - no matter what it is, Francesca does not dare to global changes in her life and buries these four days of happiness in the depths of her soul.

Buy a book


Life hacker may receive a commission from the purchase of goods presented in the publication.
